validated_predictions.evidence: FDA approved October 2019 based on UNIFI Phase 3 trial. 45% remission at 1 year.
validated_predictions.recommendation: Add to ground truth - major gap

validated_predictions.evidence: FDA approved September 2009 for moderate-to-severe plaque psoriasis.
validated_predictions.recommendation: Add to ground truth - major gap

validated_predictions.evidence: FDA approved September 2024 based on QUASAR Phase 3. 50% remission at week 44.
validated_predictions.recommendation: Add to ground truth - recent approval

validated_predictions.evidence: CCR5 blockade shown to reduce colitis in mouse models. Maraviroc (small molecule CCR5 inhibitor) effective in DSS/TNBS models. No clinical UC trials for leronlimab.
validated_predictions.recommendation: Monitor - preclinical support, no human data

validated_predictions.evidence: VEGF and Ang-2 are elevated in psoriasis. Dual inhibition rationale exists. Developed for cancer only.
validated_predictions.recommendation: Monitor - mechanism valid, no psoriasis trials

false_positives.reason: Failed Phase 2 RCT (2006). 2-7% remission vs 10% placebo. No efficacy.
Drug DISCONTINUED. Developed for asthma (anti-IL-9), never tested in MS.
Drug DISCONTINUED. Anti-IL-9 mechanism not relevant to psoriasis.
Drug WITHDRAWN from market 2019. Confirmatory trial failed, FDA revoked approval.
IL-6 inhibition is WRONG pathway for psoriasis. IL-17/IL-23 preferred. Developed for RA only.
Targets FRα (cancer marker), not FRβ (activated macrophages). Wrong target for autoimmune.
Anti-CD3 developed for Type 1 Diabetes only. No IBD research.
Sclerostin has no role in MS. Drug for osteoporosis. Black box CV warning.
EGFR antibody developed for cancer. EGFR activation may actually PROTECT in colitis.
Anti-endotoxin antibody developed for sepsis. No MS mechanism.
Anti-EpCAM antibody for cancer. EpCAM not expressed in CNS.
Anti-CD30 for Hodgkin lymphoma. CD30 not major target in UC.
Thrombolytic agent for MI. Not immunomodulatory.
Anti-VEGF/Ang-2 for cancer. VEGF inhibition may impair gut healing.
Anti-CD40 for B-cell malignancies. Different from CD40L pathway in MS.

new_filter_rules_added: IL6_PSORIASIS_MISMATCH: IL-6 inhibitors for psoriasis (wrong pathway)
BONE_DRUG_MS_MISMATCH: Sclerostin inhibitors for neurological diseases
EGFR_UC_PROTECTIVE: Anti-EGFR for UC (EGFR is protective)
key_learnings: IL-6 inhibition is wrong pathway for psoriasis - IL-17/IL-23 are correct targets
Anti-EGFR may be harmful in UC - EGFR is actually protective in colitis
Sclerostin has no CNS role - bone drugs shouldn't be predicted for MS
Cancer antibodies targeting tumor markers (FRα, EpCAM) wrong for autoimmune
Many high-confidence predictions are DISCONTINUED or WITHDRAWN drugs
25% validation rate (5/20) - slightly better than batch 1 (20%)
